    • Method Detail

      • getBestPattern

        public static String getBestPattern​(String skeleton,
                                    Locale locale)
        Obtains the most suitable format in the region specified by java.util.Locale based on a given string representing the date and time format.
        Parameters:
        skeleton - Indicates the string representing the date and time format, for example, MMDD.
        locale - Indicates the specified region based on which the date and time will be formatted.
        Returns:
        Returns the most suitable format in the specified region based on the given string representation.
        Since:
        4

      • getOrder

        public static char[] getOrder​(String pattern)
        Obtains the sequence of the year, month, and day fields in a date pattern.
        Parameters:
        pattern - Indicates the string representing the date format.
        Returns:
        Returns a char[] containing only three fields: Y for year, M for month, and D for day. The fields are displayed in the same sequence as in the date pattern.
        Since:
        4

      • is24HourClock

        public static boolean is24HourClock​(Context context)
        Checks whether the system is using the 24-hour clock.

        If users have set the time format to the 24-hour clock, this method returns true; otherwise, this method returns the result (either true or false), depending on the conventions of the current locale.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the context to use.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the 24-hour clock is used; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getLongStandAloneWeekdayNames

        public static String[] getLongStandAloneWeekdayNames​(Locale locale)
        Obtains the full names of all standalone weekdays for the locale specified by Locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - indicates locale associate with data to be retrieved
        Returns:
        Returns the full names of all standalone weekdays for the specified locale.
        Since:
        4

      • format

        public static String format​(String skeleton,
                            String languageTag,
                            String timeZone,
                            long startTime,
                            long endTime)
        Obtains the text description of a datetime interval between two calendar times.
        Parameters:
        skeleton - indicates the pattern to format a datetime.
        timeZone - indicates the timezone info.
        languageTag - indicates locale of the pattern.
        startTime - start time of a interval(milliSeconds from January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC)
        endTime - end time of a interval(milliSeconds from January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC)
        Returns:
        text description of a datetime interval between two calendar times.
        Since:
        4
